intro: Phyllorkis adenopetala, commonly known as the silky-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. Phyllorkis adenopetala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
